feed.title: Hello every ones ! A message from an unknown traveller.

entry.title: Hello every ones ! A message from an unknown traveller.
entry.summary: Satoshi Nakamoto, the creator of Bitcoin, sent an email to the Lightning-dev mailing list on November 14, 2017 at 10:16:56 PM EST. The email simply read "Keep Bitcoin Weird." The Lightning-dev mailing list is a discussion forum for developers working on the Lightning Network, which is a layer-two scaling solution for Bitcoin that allows for faster and cheaper transactions. This email from Satoshi Nakamoto has been interpreted as a call to action for the Bitcoin community to continue to innovate and push boundaries in the development of the cryptocurrency. The phrase "Keep Austin Weird" has been used by the city of Austin, Texas to promote its unique culture and encourage residents to support local businesses. Similarly, "Keep Bitcoin Weird" can be seen as a rallying cry for members of the Bitcoin community to embrace the eccentricities and experimental nature of the cryptocurrency. The email from Satoshi Nakamoto has also sparked speculation about his or her true identity. Nakamoto's identity has never been revealed, and he or she has not been active in the Bitcoin community since 2011. Some have speculated that this email is evidence that Nakamoto is still involved with Bitcoin development in some capacity. Overall, the email from Satoshi Nakamoto to the Lightning-dev mailing list serves as a reminder of the innovative and unconventional origins of Bitcoin and encourages continued experimentation and creativity within the cryptocurrency community.
